item.title: Intro BioPython Fun
item.description: Restriction Enzyme Split In the following string, using re.findall(), match restriction enzyme binding sites ANTAAT and GCRWTG.Note that per the IUPAC nucleotide code, N is any base, R is A or G, W is A or T string="" How many cuts total in the sequence do you expect if you digest with both of these restriction enzymes? How many fragments do you expect? import re re.findall(r"A.TAAT|GC[^CT][^CG]TG",string) ## ['GCGTTG', 'ATTAAT', 'GCAATG', 'ACTAAT'] Four cuts in total so that five fragments would be expected.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have been working on: Project 1 (Data Wrangling and Exploratory Analysis) Project 2 (Modeling, Inference, Prediction)

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis
item.description: Fiona Yi zy3299 Data Wrangling and Data Exploration 0. Introduction (4 pts) Write a narrative introductory paragraph (or two) describing the datasets you have chosen, the variables they contain, how they were acquired, and why they are interesting to you. Expand on potential associations you may expect, if any. Aptamers are RNA or DNA oligonucleotides developed by the SELEX (Systematic Evolution of Ligands by Exponential Enrichment) method, which selects best-binding sequences from cycles of bead-based selection,reverse transcription, PCR amplification, transcription, and PAGE RNA purification.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Fiona Yi zy3299 0. Introduction (4 pts) Introduce your dataset and each of your variables (or just your main variables if you have lots) in a paragraph. This dataset, Surgical Site Infections (SSIs) for Operative Procedures in Healthcare, displays procedure counts and infection counts submitted by different hospitals in California in 2017. Each Hospital is catagorized both by its own type and its risk-adjustment assessment, in order to better understanding the occurance of SSIs.
